p: According to the assay, S. aureus was more sensitive to the tested EOs than E. coli. However, S. kitaibelii expressed the most potent activity against both G-positive and G-negative bacteria, followed by T. serpyllum and A. clypeolata, while O. vulgare ssp. vulgare showed the weakest antibacterial activity. A. millefolium showed weak activity against E. coli but was very potent against S. aureus ( Table 2).
